body:
Hello... I'm creating this post, so I can link it in chat whenever someone asks rude questions or types rude comments because I am female.  Sometimes it can be difficult being a female gamer because of the following reasons...

Please watch this video and become aware -
playing with privilege: 25 invisible benefits of gaming while male
http://youtu.be/E47-FMmMLy0?list=PLrEnWoR732-DZV1Jc8bUpVTF_HTPbywpE

Nice post though!!!!!!!

replies.body: I read the article, and as a girl, I find this absolute bullshit and is nothing I have ever experienced before on avicus
replies.body_tagged: I read the article, and as a girl, I find this absolute bullshit and is nothing I have ever experienced before on avicus

replies.body: I don't think it's an prevalent on avicus or other minecraft servers but on other games like battlefield and counterstrike cat calling and things like that are fairly common
replies.body_tagged: I don't think it's an prevalent on avicus or other minecraft servers but on other games like battlefield and counterstrike cat calling and things like that are fairly common

replies.body:
Yeah but that kind of hate goes around, no matter your gender

People tend to get pissed off at each other and trash talk all the time.

replies.body: That's not my main point though.
replies.body_tagged: That's not my main point though.

replies.body:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dD-zQKvnl04&list=UU228Y4vvOMPieeT_XYTbe-A&index=5
q:^)
The vid might start from the end so just roll it back to the start
P.S I do realize that if you come out as a woman while gaming you might receive more attention than while being a male gamer. However, i've never seen any female getting hate just from being female in games or in real life. (I'm not counting in videos where this DOES happen from youtube or any other video broadcasting site).
Also, putting in the white gamer privilege is just not necessary. From what i've seen from experience men and women get just as much hate, regardless of the gender, this is not a female problem yo.
I could put in all kinds of bad things people have said about me while gaming, but i'm not going to. If i was a woman, i could just blame this "hate" i've been getting just for being a woman while gaming.
While i think some of the points the people made in this video are quite good, i think this is overall unnecessary and all of these happen to males too.
